alert.note: Alert for Northern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 10 at 2:17PM MST until January 11 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM THURSDAY TO 11 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THURSDAY TO 5 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. * WHERE...Northern High Plains. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 11 AM MST Thursday. For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 AM MST Thursday. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 AM Thursday to 11 AM MST Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 11 AM Thursday to 5 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
